preclusion: LL4412/LL5412/LLJ5412/LL6412 Securities and Capital Market Regulation
description:
The elective course focuses on the legal aspects of corporate finance issues, i.e. raising of funds by a company from the domestic and international markets. Major topics covered include understanding financial statements and financial ratios, equity financing through listing on recognised exchanges (including reverse/backdoor listing and rights' issue) and debt financing such as syndication loans and bond issues. 
Advisory Note for students from Civil Law Jurisdiction: Students who have not taken lessons in trust law, contract law and company law from the common law jurisdiction may have difficulty following the course.
title: Corporate Finance Law
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or common law equivalent.
